Cosmological calculatorÂ¶

SimpleMC has a cosmological calculator that allows to estimate several cosmological quantities given a model. This calculator is contained in the CosmoCalc class.

Between the options to cosmological functions there are the Hubble parameter, BAO distances, \(f \sigma_8(z)\), the age of the Universe and distance modulus.

In test_calculator.py there is an example of the use of the CosmoCalc class, where the chosen function is \(f \sigma_8(z)\). You can run this example as follows:

python test_calculator.py

and the output plot is the following:
